noun.description: Any of several varieties of apple with red-streaked skin, specifically a highly esteemed cider apple raised by Lord Scudamore in Herefordshire in the early 17th cent.; (also) a tree bearing such fruit. Compare "redstreak apple". Now rare or historical.
Cider made from such an apple.

origin: Mid 17th century. From red + streak. Compare red-streaked. With the form redstrake compare strake.
